identificationModule.briefTitle: Does Detailed Informed Consent for Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation and Mechanical Ventilation Impact Patients' Decisions and Outcomes?
identificationModule.officialTitle: Does Detailed Informed Consent for Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation and Mechanical Ventilation Impact Patients' Decisions and Outcomes?

responsibleParty.investigatorTitle: Chief Hospitalist, Associate Program Director Internal Medicine Residency

descriptionModule.briefSummary: There is evidence to suggest that patients make different end-of-life decisions if they understand the risks, benefits and alternatives of CPR and mechanical ventilation. This study will examine whether evidence-based informed consent impacts patients choices and healthcare outcomes compared to routine care.

armGroups.label: Script and Video
armGroups.description: Patients in the Script and CPR/Mechanical ventilation video arm will receive information on CPR and mechanical ventilation via a script and a video.
interventionNames: Other: Script and CPR/Mechanical ventilation video.

armGroups.label: Script only
armGroups.description: Patients in the Script only arm will receive information on CPR and mechanical ventilation via a script only.
interventionNames: Other: Script and CPR/Mechanical ventilation video.

interventions.name: Script and CPR/Mechanical ventilation video.
interventions.description: Patients will be randomized to receive the script (see addendum) plus video. Video was produced by and is the property of the study investigators.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients opting out of routine care - no intubation
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients in each group who opt out of intubation 48 hours after admission.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Number of patients opting out of routine care - no CPR
primaryOutcomes.description: Number of patients in each group who opt out of CPR within 48 hours of admission.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of deaths in each group in the hospital
Number of deaths in each group after 30 days.
Number of deaths in each group in 90 days.
Number of patients in each group who undergo CPR during their hospitalization.
Number of patients in each group who undergo intubation during their hospital stay.
